title: Marrying Mr. Darcy: A Sweet Romantic Comedy (Love Manor Romantic Comedy Book 2)
features: The laugh-out-loud and feel-good sequel to

Is it a truth universally acknowledged, that a girl can humiliate herself on reality TV and still get her fairy tale ending?Emma Brady is in shock. She fell in love with Sebastian Huntington-Ross on national television, showing everyone that opposites can most definitely attract. Now, he's asked her to marry him and live happily ever after in his fancy English manor. It's a fairy tale ending.Or is it?The problem is the TV audience wanted Sebastian to marry someone else. And in choosing Emma to be his bride, Sebastian could lose everything his aristocratic family has held dear for generations. Not to mention Lady Jilly Fotherington, who goes out of her way to make Emma feel like she doesn't belong.With enough hurdles to keep an Olympian jumping, can Emma and Sebastian find a way to stay together? Or will the pressures pulling them apart cancel their trip down the aisle?★ ★ ★ ★ ★ "A laugh-out-loud rom com with endearing characters, hilarious situations, and a touching happily ever after." -
. It's a laugh-out-loud, feel-good rom com for fans of Sophie Kinsella, Lindsey Kelk, and
description: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ "Jane Austen's novel will live on forever, so long as writers like Kate O'Keeffe keep her stories alive. With many variations out there, it is hard to choose. However, if you need some convincing, look no further than the Love Manor Romantic Comedy Series." -

★ ★ ★ ★ ★ "The perfect sequel to one of the most fun romcoms of the decade. Marrying Mr. Darcy is deliciously romantic and absolutely hilarious, but also is a poignant commentary on the times in which we live. I'm sure Jane Austen herself would have approved." -

bestselling author of laugh-out-loud, feel-good romantic comedies. She lives and loves in beautiful Hawke's Bay, New Zealand with her family and two scruffy dogs. When she's not penning her latest story, Kate can be found hiking up hills (slowly), traveling to different countries (back when we used to be able to do that), and eating chocolate. A lot of it.Visit kateokeeffe.com to sign up to her newsletter to keep up to date on new releases, great deals on books, and more.
